result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John P Peters

defendant.name: Peters, John P
defendant.address: 570 S. Clark St., Apt. B, Whitewater, WI 53190

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in court in custody with attorney Jason Daane.  ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea entered on count #1 & #4; count #2 & #3 dismissed and read in. PSI ordered and matter to be set over for sentencing. Court gives deportation, firearms warnings and voter ineligibility until civil rights are restored.  Court amends bond to allow phone contact with victims while in custody and not to discuss the cases. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Demand for Discovery

BTC: All case numbers are listed on the motion defendant needs to go through attorney -PAK
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:15 PM (64-06) Defendant John P Peters appeared by video.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Attorney Daane.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Hagerman acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of the defendant.

adj. 2:19PM
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John P Peters in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
*AMENDMENT 10-20-2022-  While in custody, defendant may have phone contact with victims. Discussion of the case is not allowed.

BOND TO COVER 22GF895, 22GF853, 22CF266 & 22CF122

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.L.D. OR V.A.L. OR RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
